{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a young marathon runner who developed pain at the anteromedial aspect of the tibia after running 100m. The pain increased with further running, but X-ray was normal. This suggests an overuse injury rather than a traumatic fracture. The doctor ordered a bonescan, which would be useful for detecting stress injuries or bone bruises.
